thread.title: Which Labour MPs voted against triggering Brexit? Full list of 52 who rebelled over Article 50
thread.title_full: Which Labour MPs voted against triggering Brexit? Full list of 52 who rebelled over Article 50

author: Dan Bloom
title: Which Labour MPs voted against triggering Brexit? Full list of 52 who rebelled over Article 50
text:
News Which Labour MPs voted against triggering Brexit? Full list of 52 who rebelled over Article 50 Theresa May survived a Tory rebellion threat as Brexit was triggered by a landslide - but Jeremy Corbyn was not so lucky Share Jeremy Corbyn faced a rebellion by 52 of his MPs (Photo: PA) Share Get politics updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
MPs tonight voted for Article 50 by a landslide - despite Theresa May blocking every amendment to her so-called 'Brexit Bill'. 
Britain is closer to the EU's door after 494 backed giving the Prime Minister permission to begin Britain's two-year exit. Some 122 voted against. 
Theresa May survived a Tory rebellion threat and crushed all 16 amendments that were formally added to the Bill . 
That added to the fury of Labour MPs who complained the Bill was being rushed through without enough scrutiny. 
Did my MP vote to trigger Brexit? Search by name or constituency after final Article 50 Bill debate 
So inevitably Jeremy Corbyn faced a repeat of last week's rebellion in which 47 MPs including 17 frontbenchers tried to block Brexit. 
This time Shadow Business Secretary Clive Lewis joined them - becoming the fourth Shadow Cabinet minister to quit and rebel against his leader. 
So did shadow business minister Chi Onwurah, leaving Labour whips with 11 frontbenchers - and three whips! - who rebelled. It's not yet been decided if they'll be sacked. 
Below are all the Labour MPs who voted against triggering Article 50 in the final vote tonight. 
Just one Tory MP, Ken Clarke, rebelled to vote against the Bill. All 52 Labour MPs who rebelled in the final vote 
* = 5 MPs who did vote against the Bill the first time, but have now after the Bill was not amended. 
** = frontbencher or whip 
*** = was a frontbencher, has already quit 
Heidi Alexander (Lewisham East) 
Rushanara Ali (Bethnal Green and Bow) 
Mr Graham Allen (Nottingham North) 
Dr Rosena Allin-Khan (Tooting)**
